etymologies: from medieval Latin, probably from Latin aquilegus ‘water-collecting’

definitions: a plant of the buttercup family, bearing showy flowers with backward-pointing spurs. Native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere, it is widely grown in gardens.

notes.text: Genus Aquilegia, family Ranunculaceae. See also columbine

shortDefinitions: plant of buttercup family, which bears showy flowers with backward-pointing spurs
